text: Bottle @ Potjepalooza, 10 cl sample. Hazy golden color, short frothy head. Aroma of funk, citrus, flowery hops, bit grainy malt. Soft sourness in taste, fruity sweetness, funk. Lovely balanced, wonderful beer.

Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza. clear yellow/golden with a white head.aroma is fresh, floral, brett, sweet, violets. Taste is fresh, floral, citrus, firm, alcohol. grass. brett. pretty saison-ish herbs. medium body, nice finish.

75cl Bottle sample at Potjepalooza. Murky golden colour, thin white head. Aroma is sour, light funky, citrus, peach. Flavour is light to medium sweet, sour peach, citrus, light funk, yeast, milky, tart finish. Light bodied. A bit rough, but nice.

Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza, thanks Caesar. Murky golden color. Aromas: brett funk, tropical fruit, sweet, yeasty. Retronasal its fruity, light sour, light bretty. Flavor is moderate sour, peachy. Light bodied. Dry finish.

Bottled. 10cl sample @ Potjepaloozas this-is-not-a-tickfest tickfest. The aroma has lots of flowers. Bit hazy, orange coloured beer with a thin off-white head. The taste is light sourish, floral, citric, lactic, tart. Really nice combination of a saison and a sour.

Bottle shared at Potjepalooza. Cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma of tart apricot, floral notes, pineapple, brett and citric urinal cakes. Flavour is above light sweet, bitter and sour. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Shared from bottle at Potjepalooza. Hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, floral, brett, light fruity, almond, apricot, light lactic. Moderate sweet and light bitter, light sour. Medium body, soft carbonation. Minerallike. Nice.

Bottle shared at Potjepalooza. Hazy golden with short lasting off white head. Tart lemon, loads of flowers, aromatic herbs and grass, light spicy yeast, lactic notes, apricot, white wine. Quite fruity with fruity Brett and a hint of lactic notes and a soft funk. Medium sour and light sweet with spicy bitter yeast. Medium bodied with fizzy carbonation. Very nice.
Bottle. Golden pour. Aroma of funky barnyard, apricot, brett, creamy vanilla, oak and horseblanket. Taste of funky barnyard, floral brett, apricot, oaky vanilla and orange. Nice one.

bytemesis is love. My god, man....  Easily one of the slickest mouthfeel Ive experienced. Adds a uniquely tuned-in rice wine "crunchiness" to the palate. Astonishingly floral throughout. Lime zest peaks through as if its spying on his neighbors have sex. A pineapple-based sourdough character aligns itself as the Dom in the aforementioned neighbor scenario, masterfully taking no prisoners and having the titillatingly clad steamed peas, damp oak, and wheat grain viciously choke on his loaf before doughing in their pretty faces.  What I like about this beer is its indefinable cohesion. Everything makes sense, its all here for a reason. Nothing is mismatched or misplaced. Nothing is wasted. I like that. It just fills me up with this satisfying clingy warmth that for future reference is similar to eating chocolate, talking to a good friend on the phone, and watching Dexter all simultaneously while knowing that Im not Slavoj iek. Jesus fucking Christ. Do you know that feeling? No? Then try it sometime, you pathetic wanker.  If that doesnt leave you exhaustively happy, I dont know what will.  Under-ripe clementine is highly giggling as it modishly shows itself off to all the spectators watching from beyond the bleachers, a good 22 minutes of letting warm in the room temperature environment. White tea is creeping right underneath.
 It doesnt have that much flavor - its not terribly complex, is what I mean. What it lacks in a distinguishable multifaceted flavor profile more than makes up for it in its mouthfeel department, which is smooth and temporarily hard like an unfiltered Vermont well water source.  Graham flour at swallow? I never thought I would write those words but you can certainly expect that as well.

Bottle: Hazy dark golden to orange color. Aroma of cider, citrus, bergamot, spices, brett, apricot. Flavor with similar components but more herbs, spices and a very dry and quite bitter herbal finish. Pretty good.

330 ml bottle, 2015 vintage, shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Amber orange, hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, white head. 
Aroma of Brett, lemon candy, spices, some fresh herbs, some stone fruits, some wood, slight cheese. 
Tastes pretty similar, very Balance and smooth. 
Medium, slightly oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. 
Finishes smooth, medium dry, medium sweet, a bit wooden, citric, Bretty, slightly cheesy.

Tasty! Very smooth and fresh, with a perfect balance, just the right amount of Brett, sourness, barrel notes and fruits. Drinks incredibly easy. Perfect style example how I love it!

0,75l bottle at Linz Tasting- shared by me. Vintage 2015. orange rather hazy color, small white head. smells dry, citric, herbal, bit pukeish, bretty, rosmarin, lavendar, lightly yeasty. nice smell. medium to full body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes herbal, lavendar, rosarmin, light yeast, some ripe fruits, peach, spices, very light sweetness, peppery, brett. finishes light to medium bitter and rather dry with notes of spices, herbs and bit peppery. lovely stuff, very good balance. very nice to drink.

Bottle. Thanks to Werkmeister. Dark cloudy golden body with off white head. Aroma is barrel sour fruits malts. Taste is sour, herbs, green apples, leather maybe some peppermint. Aftertaste is nice sour. Very nice one.

Backlog beer rating 2016
750ml bottle @ home. 2015 Vintage
Pours a hazy golden orange colour with a thin white head. Nose is floral and orange with some herbal notes. Flavour is light and tasty, some tartness with the orange juice and herbal trailing finish, perhaps some barrel character as well. Light bodied.

750ml bottle from the Pacific Liquor store in PoCo. Vintage 2016. Pours a pale golden with a white head. Aroma is flowery, citrusy, some barrel and fermented fruits notes. Taste is pretty the same with accent on fermented fruits and barrel. Carbonation is moderate. Pleasant and refreshing.

Bottle (sampled back-to-back with the non barrel aged version). Gold in colour with only moderate carbonation. Aromas are of nectarine and mild funk. Flavors are of Meyer lemon, under-ripe stone fruit, lactic sourness, and aloe. Flat on the palate due to the diminished carbonation, but somewhat saved by some tart & sour elements.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. 
Aroma is slightly acidic with moderate fruit notes of pears, tropical fruit, stone fruit and green grapes. Light citrus notes. Medium light herbal character with light phenolics. Light oak notes. A but of a honey and caramel malt note. 
Pours a golden copper color with a medium small, medium thick, white head that recedes to a small film that lingers thicker on the edges. 
Flavor has a medium light acidity with some light caramel and honey notes. Light oak notes with some medium white wine and green grape notes. Some light tannins. Moderate pear, tropical fruit and some fruit notes with hints of citrus. Light herbal notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice beer but this bottle was a few years old and the age didnt help it. I think it dulled some of the brightness that was likely present as a younger beer. I like the light acidity and fruit notes with background herbal and floral character.

Bottle at Mette and Theis. Hazy golden, medium sized diminishing white head. The nose is spicy and herbal with som ginger, bergamot and dry flowers. Flavour has honey, bergamot, ginger, barnyard, hay, wood, dandelion, citrus, camomile. Medium body, lively carbonation, mild sweet and acidic with light bitterness. Long finish with spices and barnyard.

Sample, brown bottle, 1 pint 9.4 ounces, Christmas gathering at Stephen Morriss, savoured on December 18 2015; eye: amber, clear, ring of beige head, no lacing; nose: acidity, sourness, Brettanomyces yeast, musk, green apple; mouth: acidity, sourness, Brettanomyces yeast, musk, green apple, dry finale in musk with light presence of green apple, full body, good carbonation, slick texture; overall: quite fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, bouteille brune, 1 pinte 9,4 onces, party de Noël chez Stephen Morris, savourée le 18 décembre 2015; il : ambrée, limpide, anneau de mousse beige, pas de dentelle; nez : acidité, aigreur, levure Brettanomyces, musc, pomme verte; bouche : acidité, aigreur, levure Brettanomyces, musc, pomme verte, finale sèche en musc avec légère présence de pomme verte, corsée, bonne carbonatation, texture coulante; en résumé : bien bon
Slightly hazy slight amber pour, slight white nose. Herbal citrus nose. Really cool and different. Mild sourness melds with a delicate herbal beer. Some oak and a really nice sour finish.
Bomber shared by Jeff - thanks! Slightly hazy orange pour with a white head. Perfumy citrus aroma - awesome. Taste is similar. This is terrific.

Pours hazy orange with a lasting small off-white head.Aroma is delicate with flowery, barnyard, bergamot, mild herbs and a hint of chamomile and lactic notes. Really nice stuff. Rustic in the best sense.

Bottle at Theis. Pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Dry with a light tartness. Aromas of citrus fruits and grapes. Light spicy notes wit notes of bergamot team. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry and fruity finish.

Bottle at home - thanks to SlackerMads. Cloudy amber - white head. Fruity. Orange. Abricot. Light acid. Funky. Apple notes. Peppery. Lacto notes. Zesty. Grape zesty. Grapes. Light grainy notes. Ripe pear. Nice wooden. Nice - High drinkability. Petroleum.....

750ml bottle pours out a crisp golden topped with a white head. nose is big floral sweetness barrel brett notes and a nice spice. Taste is more of the floral barrel brett spice sweetness a little fruit and a touch of tart.

Sampled at a tasting. Pale golden pour with a tiny white head. The smell is funky, floral, peachy, lemony, with a hint of basil. Tastes like grapefruit, citrus ad basil with a medicinal bitterness underneath. Dry and light bodied.

Ámbar limpio y espuma blanca abundante que desaparece rápido. Aromas de uva, cítrico, mohoso ligero, fruta amarilla, manzana verde. Cuerpo medio, sabor de fruta amarilla con cítrico del brett. y acidez redonda, suave y duradera. El final es seco, herbáceo y largo.

Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is citrusy, spicy, floral with some aromatic herbs. Taste starts tart and floral with citrus fruits and some spicy herbs. Light to medium body with a good amount of carbonation. Excellent aroma with fruity/spicy/herbal flavors.

750ml bottle from Saveur-biere.com. Pours yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of floral notes, funky yeastiness, earthy notes, grassy hops and citrus. Taste is smooth, floral and herbal with some funky yeastiness, mild farmyardy notes and hints of hops. Finish is smooth, floral and citrusy with hints of farmyard. Pretty good.

Bottle, 2014 vintage. Pours clear orange, medium beige head, disspiates with decent lacing. Aroma is vinous, oaky, white wine, light funk. Flavor is quite light tart, oaky, bright and vinous with a hint of funkiness and minimal acidity. Light body. Hugely drinkable. A+

bottle sample at our local bottle shop. poured a murky deep golden to light orange colour with a white head on top. nose of spiced brett yeast, citrus, barnyard. tart green apples, wet wood, and citrus, herbal floral notes. vineours grape notes, funk, i dont know if this is aged on a wine barrel? slightly bandaid notes, herbs. better compared to the base beer. but im still note quite impressed

Bottle from little Matt at the 2015 year end Ottawa bash. Hazy straw with an off white head that settles down to a nice foamy layer. A great funky and acidic aroma with prominent lemon zest, oak, farmhouse, bit of epson salt, moderate+ carbonation and full body, smooth, easy to drink, well balanced and long dry finish.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares, Bursprak Edition. Pours hazy murky orange with a medium white head. Aromas of brett, funky, stone fruits, oaky, vinegar, lavender, cherries, lactic. Taste has lots of stone fruits, brett, oak, lactic, citrussy, vinegar.

Bottle: Poured a hazy golden color ale with a nice large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of tart and Brett notes with some light oak and funky ester. Taste is a nice mix between some hay flavours with some notes of Brett and funky ester and a light tart finish with some oak presence that is noticeable. Body is about average with good carbonation. Nice saison with loads of complexity while retaining some great drinkability.

Bottle @ Dangerous bottleshares. Pours hazy orange with a white fluffy head. Aroma of weak stone fruits, some dry brett, oak, lavender, lacto tartness and weak vinegar. The taste has some peach, some citrusy notes, brettt, oak, funky barnyard and pretty rural. Nice and harmonic.

2015 Xmas gathering. Pours slightly cloudy straw with limited head and some lacing. Nose is quite lemony. Flavours of lemon, vinegar, peach. Taste medium tart, light sweet. Medium body with lively carbonation. A beauty!

A hazed golden saison with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with lemony notes, woody notes, light Brett, curacao, very nice. In mouth, a tart sweet fruity malt with light Brett, light lactic notes, curacao, tart and refreshing. Bottle at Ottawa Xmas gathering 2015.
Bottle @ Dangerous bottleshare. Cellar cleaning edition 1.0. Hazy orangish pour with a dense head. Stone fruits, floral notes, subtle brett, peaches, oak and leather.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours a hazy orange with big, dark chunks of sediment and a big, dense, white head. Aroma is super funky, barnyard, stone fruits, slight lacto, soapy, lavender. Taste is fresh, slightly tart, very funky, lots of fresh stone fruits like peach and apricot, again slightly floral. Super fresh, high carb and a smooth, sparkling body. Dry finish.

Really nice improvement on a base beer that was already good. The floral herbal aroma and flavor shines through the funk more than expected, giving this quite a bit more complexity than the base. Really nice to sit back with.

Shared at a tasting hosted by Steve Hackley on September 25. Thanks Steve! This was poured from a 750 mL bottle. The pour is a light orangey gold, quite hazy, with a small ring of head that falls off quickly. This seemed to pour pretty syrupy. The aroma is something else. There is an incredible heavy mint to this. There is a little more light citrus, some vinous grape skin, and a little funky spice. There is a little saison thats hiding in there. The flavor is not something Im too fond of. There is a lot of barrel to it, which is why its getting scored a little higher than I would normally do it. There is a lot of yeast and spice going on with a strong mint presence again. There isnt a resounding sourness, but its just lightly crisp. The mouth feel is thicker and syrupy. Its not at all what I would like to see from a sour or a saison. The aftertaste is a little bit like a cider, but the spice and funk I just cant get past. It could be so much better.
Hazy light orange with pretty much no head. Aroma is gin botanicals, orange juice. Light bodied, fruity on the palate with a slightly herbal finish. Taste is herbs, botanicals, orange juice.
Bright ginger aromas.Cloudy gold color with ring of head. Clean soap florals saison spice. Amazing.

Bottle from dresden, shared with the the wife, thanks man! Appearance is golden with straw white head. Aroma is white wine, grass, sweaty socks, white grapes, perfume, and oak. Taste is vinous white wine, light funk, Apple cider, white grapes, and oak. Decent mouthfeel, moderate carb. Pretty good, really an interesting beer, there is a ton of barrel character in this, so much so that it tastes somewhat like a cider, I dont get a lot of the base saison taste but this is still really tasty.

Slightly hazy golden orange with a short white head. Aroma is distinctly fruity. Smells a lot like green koolaid with brett, some peach and floral notes as well. Flavour is slightly yeasty, lime juice, a bit of perfume, slightly tart but not much. Great stuff

Soft and hazy light apricot blonde pour with a wispy head. Very nice nose, minty with notes of lime, flowers, spice, brett and anise. Minty flavor with a dry and spicy quality with a light note of acetaldehyde. Very light body with a dry quality.
Golden, white fine foam, ecucalyptus, light medium body, tannin, light Astringency, fruit flavors. Not a lot of aroma andits at 56 f

Bottle - Funky grape, acidity and some apricot notes. Hazy gold orange with a rich white head. Up front tartness, some cheesy fund and apricot. Nice, light, tart and little of the aromatics or herbal notes from the original.

Bottle shared. Hazy gold pour with thick, lacy, creamy white head. Aroma is really nice, lots of lacto, peachy aroma, white wine, really fruity. Taste is tart, nice acidity, not acetic, fruity acidity, light grainy notes, good bitterness. Palate is med bodied with soft carbonation. Very easy drinking, delicious.
Bottle thanks to Matt. Pours a cloudy orange with large frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong citrus and funk. Medium mouth with nice citrus, funk, tart, really enjoyed this.
Poured from a 750ml bottle, thanks to Doug. Tart, lemon, dusty, hay, slight spicy note, hint of vanilla on the back end.

750ml bottle. Clear pale pour, nice frothy egg white head. Bubbles stick around as a film. Aroma is hugely botanical - is this gin barrel aged? Lemon zest, medicinal, pickle juice, pears. Taste: softer medicinal than the nose; not sour, but light tartness in the finish. Packs a lot of flavor/body for a 5.5% beer, but sill makes me think of a throat lozenge. Finishes reasonable dry. Palate: medium+ body, average carbonation, surprisingly smooth creamy texture. Overall: reminiscent of special herbs (but not as good).

Bottle courtesy of Prufrock -- thanks!

Orange pour, modest head. Strongly herbal aroma dominates everything else going on the beer. Slightly sweet, a bit of lacto tartness, big flavor for 5.5%. Is this aged in gin barrels? It reminds me of Special Herbs, it has some juniper elements, and I certainly dont get any bourbon or cognac or rum. Could be wine barrels I guess. Interesting beer but neither is it quaffable nor does it come together for me into something special.
Bottle pours hazy orange with medium head. Aroma is earthy with some zesty orange. Taste is light dusty spice with a dry and light tart finish, light throat tingling.

Bottle, 11/30/2014. Huge gusher. Pours cloudy orange color, hazy white head. Aroma is citrus, pine needles, floral notes, hay and lactic funk. Taste is juicy citrus, tangerine with chartreuse-like herba; notes, some bitterness blending with mild funk, wood. Light, bright body. Very nice.

Bottle via the great GT2  first beer of Thanksgiving Day. Pours a restrained peach color with very small head of large white bubbles that fades to a gorgeous patina of large-bubbled lacing. Awesome look. Aroma is insanely good: juicy nectarine, peach, plum, mango, and white wine hit first, along with lambic-like bugs and hoppy/oaky earthiness reminiscent of mustier Cantillon bottles, then the whole thing opens up into subtle gin botanicals, spice, and lemon peel, with a faint tartness, like lemon juice and crushed berries. Taste is juicy while remaining crisp, with unripe sour peach and oaky Chablis mingling with doughy and crackery grains, fading into subtle pineapple, raspberry seed, lavender, and oak tannins. Vinous, lightly oily finish. Crazy mixture of complexity and drinkability, with perhaps a bit too much oakiness being the only drawback. Blows many Hill Farmstead saisons out of the water.

This poured a bright orange with a white head. Aroma was of lots of earth, wet rocks, fruity and earthy hops, oranges, wheat. Flavor similar, good bit of white wine, citrusy fruit, grass, wet rocks, minerally, light funk. Well integrated.

The beer pours a dull orange amber color. Its quite cloudy. The head is smallish and creamy with fine bubbles. Dissipates quickly. The aroma is floral with lacto sourness and a mild oak note. Orange peel, yogurt and flowers. Taste is gently tart with underlying floral sweetness. Tasty stuff. Lots of citrus flavor, oranges and lemons. Medium oak. Earthy saison character in the background. Finishes fairly dry. Gentle, creamy mouthfeel that really adds to the beer. Easy to drink. Lots of flavor. Delicious beer.
Rich wine like character, some farmhouse upfront. Very drinkable, and above average mouthfeel.

Bottle shared with big thanks to beerman6686. Cloudy yellow orangey slight red pour. Floral perfumey aroma, potpourri esque. Some funkiness. Taste is slightly sour. Tangy finish but extremely drinkable.

Had this at the 2014 RB Pittsburgh Summer Gathering at Horny Devils place. Actually it was after the equinox at the beginning of fall, but DILLIGAF. Big thanks to James & Michelle for hosting such a nice spread of quality beers and for this particular beer a GIANT thanks goes out to beerman6686. Slight tart aroma. Cloudy pale with a tad of brown in there. Good sizzle augmented by a slight tart bite. Yes, slight friendly tart nibble. Not a whole lot of bitterness but enough in there to keep you aware this is beer. Overall quite easy going and fun to be with.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 75cl, as Upright Flora, new exclusive American brew Anno 2013, with flowers, thx alot to John for bringing this over!, very complex brew, floral/woody/fruity and slightly vinous, balanced, cloudy, small head, good brew

Disappointed. Thanks Collin for the share at Zwanze. Has a spiciness to it and a nice hint of lactic tartness but not as robust a flavor spread as I had hoped for. Would like to try again later and see if I was just too into the day at that point.
Smells incredibly herbal with fruity passion fruit. Very light. Tart finis. Sulphite sort of mouthfeel. Lot of white grapes. it has some interesting rye spice herbal notes going on here.

Bottle courtesy of noodleuser, thank you! Cloidy golden yellow color, bright white head. Aroma of vanilla, peaches soaked in white wine, attic eaves, overripe pears. Taste is softly sour and funky grapefruit, pineapple, dust, white pepper. Deleicious.

750ml bottle pours an orangey brown color without much of a head. Sharp sourness at first but eases out with some breathing to balance nicely against the saison wild yeast flavors. Oakiness lingers at the end.

720 ml bottle shared by noodleuser at the DC Local Tasting. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral notes, herbs, light funk, citrus peel. Tastes of pine, floral notes, citrus, white wine. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Low carbonation.

750ml bottle pours a hazy, neon orange with some ringing, white head. Nose has plenty of apricot, mild funk, a little dry gin, a little lime zest, a little lemon-lime soda, a little bright saltwater/tonic. Flavor is so solid, tart, lemony, some dandelion, lime, a little briny oyster with lemon, a little mild mustard seed, mild taffy. Clean, bright finish. Not much barrel, but very bright and refreshing.
Good light notes of barrel in this with good bretta, grapefruit, citrus and a tart finish. Lots of wood and slight astringency. Orange peel. Soft carbonation. Bottle thanks to someone at tasting.
Oak and lemon aroma. Cloudy amber, thin head. Lemon and oak on back end. Subtle intermittent grassiness.
750ml bottle. Poured a hazy yellow, orange color with a off-white head. Aroma is light tart notes, some vanilla. Flavor is some wood, some tartness, nice.
Pours a cloudy bright golden with white head. Oak, barrel, funk, tartness, and some wheat on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes tart and dry.
At my place with Taylor, Justin, Kristen, and Matt. Pours bright orange, lacing. Aroma is tart fresh brisk Brett, some citrus. Taste is beautiful delicate light acidity, orange, fresh.

Thanks to Jeremy! Tasting glass form 750 ml. bottle. Orange with creamy white head. Smell is reminiscent of Sprite (interesting & it smells great) with creamy zesty fruits, peach, light funk, dough, touch lactic. Taste is amazing & unified Gin, very mellow lactic, Sprite, zest, very fruity, sweet fruits, dough, zest, white berries, caramel, oak, Creamy, very easy to drink. Unique, amazing, simply spectacular.

Bottle 
Pours yellow / orange . Good white head . Smell is sweet , many spices , refreshing , wood . Good carbo . 
Taste is Full , bitter , sweet , funky ( brett ) oak . Bit perfumy .

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2014 effervescent hazy gold, half-inch large-bubbled white head drops to spotty lacing. Really rustic nose, tons of dusty hay and dirty wheat, high acidity contrasts with slick nose and tangerine phenols from the obvious brett influence, light lime in lactic acid. Front is all lime, huge lactic presence across the slick mid alongside light peach and rind, lightly eggy brett dominance emerging late with faint dusty hay, almost no grain across the finish. Delicate carbonation tickles palate, elevates the dryer elements wonderfully. The rustic start on the nose and in the deep finish are my favorite part, balanced and subtle throughout but a mish mash. 
[ Bottle ][ 1/3  of 75cl ][ Tasting ][ ][ Tulip ][ 11.29.14 ]Hazy orange, puffy white head dies quickly, lacing excellent. Lightly doughy perfume nose, still floral but more vanilla-oak soft. Odd contrast in flavor, lactic vanilla chardonnary battling with vegetal celery notes, salty with light florals mid, citrus still there, contrasted through the effervescent finish, lightly peppery. Botanicals rule this like rustica, more balance, ultra high attenuation but dischordant. 747414[ 11.28-29 Tasting Ranking ] 01. Saison DuPont  4.802. RR Temptation (b004)  4.803. Orval (03/2014)  4.704. RR Temptation (05/30/2013)  4.505. Blue Lobster Little Lobster on the Prairie  4.406. F&M Dochter Seizoen  4.307. HF Le Serrasin  4.208. F&M Lunaire  4.109. F&M Paradisaea  4.110. HF Arthur (01/2014)  4.011. RR Sonoma Pride Amasa  4.012. HF Flora (b4)  3.813. HF Nordic Saison  3.814. De la Senne Crushable Saison  3.815. RR Sonoma Pride Dauenhauer  3.816. Prairie Puncheon  3.717. Upright BA Flora Rustica  3.618. SARA Stenciled Pages  3.619. RR Sanctification (b005)  3.520. Upright Flora Rustica  3.421. HF Convivial Suarez  3.422. SARA Cask 200  3.323. TH Paraguesia1  3.324. Upright Rose City Seven  3.325. TH The Emptiness is Not Eternal  3.226. Wicked Weed Bretticent  3.227. SARA Saison Bernice  3.028. HF Civil Disobedience 10  3.029. TH Handfarm b4  2.930. Wicked Weed Serenity  2.831. Almanac Reserve Citrus  2.432. Hopfarm Margo  2.233. Almanac Sourdough  2.1

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 Pour is dark amber, mostly clear, with a tight white head. Nose has a light vanilla oak note with a strong clean tangerine similar to that in lambic. A good hint of citrus and a touch of lime, moderate herbal/floral aroma as in the non barrel aged version. Taste is heavily bretted, faint vanilla oakiness with a nice bright tangerine and notes of lime.  Gets a bit sweet and tannic but nothing major. The floral herbal notes come in as it warms.  Moderate carbonation and very soft delicate body with a hint of sourness.

bottle thank you to johns grocery and &e for courtesy. aroma of bright peach. yogurt. lemonjuice. soft peachy apricot fruit. bit of dusty cobweb character. neat. moderate- heavy watery lemonjuice. aroma quite nice. taste a bit too much lemonjuice without enough balance. quite dry. low carbonation @ this gold ale. touch too sharp with the dry dusty lemons. low carbonation gueuzelike essense. aroma a highlight. taste and palate good, but not grate on this bootle @ least. neat. fun to drink.
Des fruits mûres et des élans herbacés dans une concoction rustique et rafraîchissante imprégnée dacide lactique.

My Bottom Line:
White grapes and lactobacillus are found throughout this Wild Ales haystack, leading to classy citrus fruit lengths and much refreshment.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the hazy pale orange.
-The flavor profile is superbly cohesive.
-The mouthfeel is lean and refined.
-The tiny bubbles contribute to this impression of refinement.
-This is not just another barrel-aged wild brew. Its not a work in progress either.

Bottle.

(Bottle) Pours hazy orange with an off-white head. The aroma is fantastic with notes of wet stone/minerals, citric lacto/lime, wood, flowers, tart tropical fruits, white wine, morning rain, wheat crackers and wonderful dirty. Touch of earthy hops and raspberries/cherries. The flavour is light sweet, light to medium acidic and light bitter. Juicy, lacto-ish and mild hoppy with a perfect, discrete malt profile. The mouthfeel is juicy and soft with light to medium carbonation. Lacto-ish finish. Light to medium bodied.

Bottle received in trade. Thank you GT2 for letting go of this gem. Pours hazy vibrant reddish golden with a frothy white head that leaves lots of lacing and trace on the glass. Smell is sour and fruity with wheat crackers, yuzu, lemon zest, unflavoured yoghurt, hay, dry soil, barnyard, pineapple, starfruit, passionfruit, white grapes, dry wood and leather. Taste is slightly sour, tiny bitter and funky with crackers, cereal, hay, grapefruit juice, lime juice, yuzu, pineapple, mango, dry soil, white pepper corns, unflavoured yoghurt, lemon zest, orange zest, passionfruit, wild strawberries, lemon grass and subtle hints of rubber. Mouthfeel is dry, soft, tart, very tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is slightly sour, tiny bitter and tiny funky with crackers, grapefruit juice, lime juice, yuzu, hay, dry soil, white pepper corns, orange zest, lemon zest, unripe pineapple, unflavoured yoghurt, wild strawberries and passionfruit. Simply magical
Bottle. Slightly tart nose. Winey. A little tart but otherwise kinda flat I flavor.
Bottle share thanks to Homer321. pours a fairly clear, orange color. Funky, sweet, light barnyard, citrusy. Citrusy, sweet, barnyard, refreshing, very nice.
Bottle share thanks to Homer. Pours golden. Aroma of sweet tarts. Taste is smooth, sweet, tart.

Bottle at Asheville pre-grand tasting. Pours orange gold with white head. Nose/taste of lemon, peach skin, white wine, oak, lacto sourness, citrus funk, floral funk and some horseblanket. Medium body. Moderate well balanced acidity.

25.4 oz bottle. Misty pink orange with a lacy white head. Nose is vanilla custard, wild flowers, lemon peel, honey and funk. Slick and oily medium body with a few carbs pricks, almost still. Taste is so delicate. Spring water with sumac and tarragon. Lightly sour with an earthy finish.
Hazy tan. Botanical aroma...totally gruit. Sage, rosemary, touch acidic, blackberry, fruity, super refreshing, a touch woody.

Bottle courtesy of Vinny. Pours a bright hazy orange body with thick white lacing. Aroma is bright funk, citrus funk, light oak and earthy character. Mouthfeel is tart and funky with notes of bright citrus funk, earthy farmhouse, nice horsy character and floral flavor.

Tasted on 2/7/14 from a capped 750mL bottle at the Friday night tasting at RBWG Asheville, big thanks to GT2 for sharing. Pours hazy light orange with a thick white head that slowly recedes to average lace. The nose is gin botanical with a savory note (perhaps cumin), lactic sour, and has a tart vinous note. The flavor is a bit more lactic sour with all of the botanical notes on the back, but without that herbal savory thing from the nose. The body is medium with lively carbonation and a long tart gin finish.

Pours a lot clearer then the base beer, really nice looking golden color. Flavors are clean and sharp. A lot of white wine acidity with herbaceous tones. You can tell the barrel selection was a big part of crafting this beer. The tartness is just perfect, what a delicious Saison, I wish I had five more.

Thanks to errl for sharing this bottle. Hazy orange pour with a white head. The aroma has some strong yeast notes as well as some oak and lemon character. The flavor is similar. The lemon and orange notes really stand out, with some biscuit and oak notes also coming through. There is a bit of funk and a hint of tartness. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. A very nice saison.
Bottle...Pour is golden with a thin head..Nose is musty, funk, oak, dry..Taste is nice grain, spice, oak, dry, tartness..

Bottle poured into a plain wine glass because Upright still refuses to make proper glassware. I guess for now well just have to settle for fantastic beer. Light white wine and spicing with a mild lactic character. Nothing too overpowering and blended well with the base beer.

20th February 2014Fare thee well Josh tasting at Bruces. Thanks to Bruce. Cloudy gold beer, small pale cream coloured head. Palate is light, airy and dry. Mild crispness. White wine, lightly sour. Little floralness and tangerine - also both a touch sour. Light dry finish. Barreling definitely improved this one. Unusual beer.

750 ml bottle shared at the RBWG Downtown Inn bottle share on Friday night. Pours a hazy gold color with a small white head. Notes of lemon, juniper, wood, straw, vegetal notes, celery salt, florals, and herbs. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a tart, earthy mouthfeel. Really nice saison.

Bottle shared in London for my farewell drinks. Big thanks to Bruce. Pours hazy golden with a tight, dense white cap on top. Nose is like the regular - lemon and zest but taken to the next level. More zest and a juiciness to it. Taste is juicy and tangy lemon and grapefruit, nice progressive nsourness and absolutely chock full of zest and citric tang which works a treat. Sweet fruits come through nicely behind the sourness and it has a nice dry finish. Great beer

Bottle shared at Joshs Farewell Hoorah - big thanks to Bruce the host with the most, 20/02/14.
Hazed orange amber with a moderate beige head that thins to spotting.
Nose is funk laden, tarte fruits, bitter orange, straw, woody tones, lemon sherbet, wine BA twang, light brett.
Taste comprises tarte grapes, light spice, woody BA wine twang, lemon rind, orange peel, subtle brett.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid stuff, takes the base beer up a good few notches.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London during Joshs farewell tasting. Pours lightly hazy gold with a mellow, frothy white head. Nicely funky on the nose with tart lemon, florals, a bit of pale wood. Light sweet flavor with pale woody dryness, lightly tart citrus fruits, orange, tangerine, mellow funk. Light bodied with fine, spritzy carbonation. Moderate dryness to finish, decent funky citrus fruits, barnyard, poo, tangerine. Lovely.

Bottle thanks to Bruce. It pours hazy golden with a small white head. The nose is earthy, funky, sharp, lactic, some acidity, vinous, barnyard, floral and dough. The taste is crisp, sharp acidity, lactic, wood, cream cheese, barnyard, white grape and gooseberry, with a dry, wood finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well judged. Rounded and quaffable.

Bottle. Clear light yellow pour with a white head. Florally aromas. Light crisp floral notes with vinous undercurrents. Above average body and mouthfeel. Easy sipping and refreshing. A perfect sunny afternoon session beer!!!!!

Bottle at RWBG 2014, thanks! Pours a hazy light orangish gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a strong gin presence with light fruits and a touch of tartness. Flavor has a nice gin and light tart fruit combination with a bit of sweetness backing.

Bottle Generously shared by gt2 at rbwg. Thanks bro! Another fantastic "Saison" from upright. Definitely enters the sour/wild ale realm like many of the Buggified and/or barrel/wine aged saisons from hill farm, tired hands, others I have had. Very nice funk throughout with a light stone fruity tartness that lingers nicely on the tongue.
Bottle at RBWG, courtesy of someone. Pours a golden color with white head. Floral, funk, oak spice flavors. Nice.

Sample from a 750ml bottle. Thin white head, little lace sticks... But a pretty pretty mostly hazy orange golden color. Good looking stuff. Awesome big floral aroma. Very nice, balanced belgian yeast character. Wow. Moderate zesty sweet taste. Very nice long floral zesty sweet aftertaste, very awesome belgian yeast character. Excellent medium to bigger body. Smooth, lighter carbonation. Perfect texture to this. Lightly slick. This is a crazy fantastic saison. Wow.

Poured by GT at RBWG. Pours hazy golden with some white head. Aroma of some tropical fruits and gin. Taste is piercingly tart. Damn, wasnt expecting that. More pineapple, tropical fruity business. Prickly on the palate. Finishes with more funk. The aroma in this one is considerably softer than the taste. Really good stuff.

Bottle @ RBWG Fart Share. Pours a milky yellow appearance with a white head. Really spritzy, bright tropical fruity, moderate juniper / gin aroma. Lightly tart, potpourri / floral, funky, herbal, pineapples Flavor. Fun. Cool.

Bottle sent to the Utah guys from Doug, thanks for remembering us here in the beer wasteland 
Clear golden with a medium sized white head and some lacing. Aroma was floral, spices and woody. Flavor is floral, woody, vanilla with a mild bitterness in the finish 
Nice and tasty

Pours a slightly hazy burnished dark gold with a loose white head that goes away. Big intense floral nose, spicy eastern floral perfume notes, ginger, turmeric, oak, vanilla, lilac. Creamy, sticky, moderately carbed medium body. Oaky bite leads, intense floral complexity with spicy and sweet notes on the mid palate, some light white pepper, lots of moderately toasty caramel.

Bottle at my parents with the wife. Pour is hazy orange with a decent sized head and good lacing. Big floral, candied orange peels, fresh pine needles, somewhat minty, lacto, light vanilla, lemons, soapy, and herbal aroma. Taste is orange juice, grassy, big lacto, oak notes, lemon peel, medicinal, a touch of funk, piney, and green apples with a lightly tart bite on the backend. Medium body with medium-to-high carbonation. Really great sessionable BA beer. Not sure I enjoy it more than the original though.
Pour is hazy yellow brown. Some floaties. Spicy aromas. Lemon and pine cleaner. Vanilla and barrel character. Lots of exotic spice. Chamomile and safron. Jasmine perhaps. Great beer.

A - pours orange/honey with almost no head and no lacing. S - this smells damn good. The lacto and ba really shine here. Smells sour. Notes of sweet citrus and yeast. M - low carb and medium body. The front end is nice. Sweet and tart, but the palate and end fall flat. Disappointing. Lackluster end. T - the warmer this gets the better. The front is nice sweet citrus, lightly tart lacto and some barrel notes. On par with many really good barrel saisons, but almost immediately the beer falls apart. The flavor profile dies very quickly to a metallic and cheese funky flatness. O - this beer smells and tastes damn good initially like 4.2, then goes flat. 3.8

750 ml bottle at home - thanls to Todd Hannon - thank you very much!. Pours hazy honey yellow with a thin bubbly head. Nose is a special mix of green, fruity, spicy and flowery notes; pine, some apricot, resin, cloves; elderflower and lime peel. Light to medium body with subtle creamy start, sourness kicking through in the middle and ending sweet and medium dry. Fruity taste of peach and pineapple. Bitter ending. Quite special, a typical American saison but with that tad extra - lacto just showing in a slight sour note. This is quite drinkable. ANd lots of taste for only 5.5%. Like it!

pours hazy pale yellow with a small but really nice white cap, good retention and a resilient film. very floral and limey, citrus-lime and minty fresh, almost sprite *TM -like, berry-like fruitiness and maybe a hint of tropical fruits, roses and lilac, dust and soft brettiness, wineyness too, hint of vanilla. bright carbonation, light body - never watery, light acidity - very nice blend of lactic/citric, lime-oriented and grassy-limey finish. very good ba-saison, as good if not more (but fairly different) than the non-ba version.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours pale golden with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, fruits, lime. Taste is of fruits, citrus, sourness, lime, white wine. Palate: Light body. Overall: Very good. "Light" but classy. Winy. Very drinkable.

Bottle (750 ml). From Lurkaholic and shared by czar and mathieuc, thanks! Clear golden/orange with a small persistent white head and some lacing. Aroma is really enticing with brettanomyces, white wine, strong lime presence and some peaches/apricots. Taste is of brettanomyces, white wine, citrus, oak and peaches. Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Winey mouthfeel. Very good barrel-aged Saison. The lime make this one so drinkable. Quite complex too. I love it!

Pours a nice golden with a thin white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is fresh (minty), fruity and floral. Or maybe it was eucalyptus instead of mint? Oh well, hypnotizing to say the least. Taste is tart and again fresh with nice lemony feel and dry. Body was light, carbonation medium (just how I like it). Quaffable. Overall this was a really fresh, fresh, fresh and refreshing drink and I could drink a lot of this. Awesome!
More of a muted, subtle and complex use of lacto, unlike the wild super sourness some brewery use.

Bottle... Poured hazy, golden with a thin head. Awesome aroma. Funk, wood, spices. Im surprised at all the musty notes I was getting on this with the lacto. But nice acidity with a light mouthfeel. Mild lemon/citrus, other light, vibrant fruits, with a good fruitiness. Could drink this stuff all day.

750 ml bottle. Pours gold with medium white head. Aromas of oak, yeast, and tropical fruit. Flavors of pitted fruit, vanilla, wood, light bubblegum, and gummy bears. Creamy and tart. Medium carbonation and body. Excellent.

Bottle from Les Caves, Corvallis. Pours a slightly cloudy golden color. Aroma is delicate yet complex, with lacto and wood shining on nose. Body bright, fluffy and light, decent amount of tartness. Upright do it again!

Bottle Courtesy of Todd. Thanks man! This one is really fanfuckingtastic. Pours a cloudy straw golden with frothy white head. Aroma is bretty funk, spicy oak, doughy malts. Taste is light lactic tartness and a meld of bretty pineapple, sourdough, sharp lemon, wet wood and some melon. I love this beer and its right up there with Flora by HF as two of my favorite beers that happen to have the same name. Dont Sue each other guys...

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2013 Bottle shared by Tim and Bill at session. Poured hazy golden orange with minimal white head. Nose is delicate frowerr yeast, peaches, pepper, rose petals, lactic vino funk, wet wood, and barn. Flavor is tangerine, peach, complex brett, basement wetness, wood, and Carbonation and body were light to medium. Long lasting earthy finish. Awesome stuff.

Bottle thanks to GT. Pours a translucent amber with medium head. Crazy complex nose that takes a while to dissect, with peach, melon, light funk, yeast, lime, fresh herbs, and a spicy floral note. The palate is dry but at the same time rich that manages to be fruity, herbal, and floral at the same time. Quite amazing.

Juniper, lemon verbena, pine sap, orange peel, so robust and aromatic its sharp on the nose. Pretty intriguing aroma overall. Malty but tart, lemon peels, slight oxidation, lots of herbal botanical notes, juniper and maybe rosemary. Lime pulp and lactic acid. Finish is a little oxidized but otherwise a really nice beer.

Bottle shared by GT. Hazy golden orange pour with a white head. Really nice aroma. Blend of tartness and herbs on the nose. Rosemary, lemon, apricot, and oak. A bit of white grape, pepper, and floral aromas. Flavor has a bit more herbal character to it. Rosemary is prominent. Nice lemon zest and acidity. Apricot and white grape fruitiness, some floral notes, oak, and a dry, tart finish.

750 ml. bottle. It pours a nice orange gold color with a thin white head. The aroma is strong with fresh lemon verbena and lime. Lots of florals and a nice subdued wine barrel funk. Wow, this is unique stuff. The flavor is similar with lots of tart, lemony lacto and some floral bitterness. A little wood near the finish. Very clean with light summer fruit coming in as it warms. Oh man this is good. Im really glad I have another bottle.
Capt. HO LEE FUK, this is awesome, tons tons tons of flavors, every sip revealed something new, floral, caramel, medium body, long finish, soft carbonation, bretty, great great stuff

Bottle. Amber beer with a cream head. Red wine and light yeast aroma with tartness and light spice. Tart/sour flavor with lemon, light acetic notes, and light oak. Medium bodied. Tartness/sourness and lemon lingers with light hay, light acetic notes, and oak.

750mL from the brewery.

A: Cloudy orange with a thin foam for a head. Decent lacing

N: Lots of oak, peppercorn, banana, lemon, some funk, rosemary.

T: Quite tart and very woody to the point of bitterness. Very earthy; attic spaces and cut lawns.

M: Very dry. Light.

O: Has plenty in common with a Lambic, however, its not as nuanced to me. Great if you like intense cedar,pine, and oak, though.

750mL bottle, pours a hazy golden orange with small white head. Aroma brings out loads of floral notes, some coriander, and Belgian yeast. Flavour brings out loads of floral notes, some coriander-like spices, some of the lacto, and a bit of the barrels subtly contributing. Very floral and fairly spicy, with a medium palate. The barrels dont add that much to this, as this is still very floral and spicy. Solid stuff, but not as good as the original.

750, capped and waxed. Thanks, G! Pours a slightly hazy burnished dark gold with a loose white head that goes away. Big intense floral nose, spicy eastern floral perfume notes, ginger, turmeric, oak, vanilla, lilac. Creamy, sticky, moderately carbed medium body. Oaky bite leads, intense floral complexity with spicy and sweet notes on the mid palate, some light white pepper, lots of moderately toasty caramel. Long sticky reedy sweet finish.

750mL thanks to brainlair. Pours a full haze, glowing peach. Medium to lower white foam with a tepid pour to not disturb yeast. Delicate lacing. Nose is really just out of this world- it is the culmination of Uprights quest for a distinctive, delicate, farmhouse house yeast and it really shows. Fresh blossoms, yellow rose petals, juicy nectarine, mojito, flashes of fresh sourdough biscuit, touches of sweet cream butter prominent in Hill Farmstead saisons. As it warms there is an amazing fresh sourdough biscuit with orange marmalade that is just out of this world. Taste is perfectly refreshing- acidic but not sour, juicy with peach and pineapple. Tropical, but not sweet. Mojito like with lime and fresh delicate herbs. Mouthfeel is juicy, soft, quenching. As it warms, leathery white grapefruit rind piles on similar to world class Geuze like 3F Armand & Tommy. Perfect saison. Demands to be consumed in large gulps like a true farmyard refreshment. Same level as Hill Farmstead Ann. Doesnt even come across as the herbal medley that was normal Flora Rustica. This has softened up and become one of those transcendent saisons.

Bottle courtesy of "hannont". Colour...very light golden straw with a thick white head. Nose...eminently fruity with mostly citrus fruits coming through. Palate...very tangy with Country Time lemonade flavours as well as Gatorade original and diet cola. This beer has an interesting array of flavours but it all works well as far as my palate is concerned. Im curious to see how this beer ages.

750 ml bottle from the brewery. Pours a somewhat hazy copper color with a large white head. A big nose of barnyard funk, light dandelion, woody. The flavor is excellent: big funky dusty notes, white wine, apricot, lighter suggestions of tartness but overall almost all funk from the bacteria, lemons, more oak, some vanilla comes in. Maybe Im crazy but I get some yoghurt (same bacteria). Nice brew.
